185980991.review: Was good on console. Better on steam

185954084.review:
Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3 was a game I played a lot more back when it was a big deal during the PS3 era.

I know it's a super popular game since it brought a ton of big names to the fighting game scene, but I always had mixed feelings about it.

It was hyped up as this crazy rushdown game, especially since it didn’t have much competition in the team assist category within the fighting game scene.

Back then, I mostly liked it for the cool crossovers and just playing super casually. But when it came to playing online or competitively? Nah, it wasn’t that fun. The game doesn’t really teach you how to play at a competitive level—you basically have to hit up YouTube or watch footage to figure things out.

Funny enough, I started appreciating the game more after playing more modern team fighters, like Dragon Ball FighterZ, BlazBlue: Cross Tag Battle, and even Marvel vs. Capcom: Infinite.

Over time, I began to understand why people loved Marvel 3 so much back in the day. It’s fast-paced, gives you tons of options, and manages to strike a good balance between Marvel and Capcom characters.

That said, I’m still salty we never got a version of Mega Man in Marvel 3. But hey, at least we got Phoenix Wright, I guess.

The story mode is pretty weak—just a basic arcade mode with a bit of dialogue at the beginning and end—but it’s still fun to see different characters take on the final boss, Galactus.

Sadly, Marvel 3 still doesn’t have rollback netcode, which really sucks. Marvel Infinite launched with great netcode, and now even Marvel vs. Capcom 1 and 2 have rollback thanks to the Marvel vs. Capcom Collection and Fightcade.

Hopefully, we’ll get to a point where Marvel 3 officially gets rollback netcode. Even though I probably still suck at it, I’d be down to jump online and get back into the groove.

185890664.review: While it definitely doesn't live up to its storied lineage, MvC 3 is a competent fighter. If you're seeking out something to try for couch-multiplayer, you will likely have some fun. My main complaints deal with some of the hassle involved in getting this version up and running as well as the generic-feeling art direction. Gone are the gorgeous, hand-drawn characters with dynamic animation. Instead, we get some stiff CG and not a lot of color. The game is just ... dark. But, despite that, I found gameplay to be fun enough to look past the drabness.

185353055.review:
マーブル（マーベル？）側のキャラはほとんど知りませんが、その中でX-23は、かなり普通に美少女で驚きです。
オンラインは全くやっていないので（そもそも、今さらな時期ですが）対戦環境は分かりませんが、チェーンとエリアルでつなぎやすく、とりあえず触った感じは楽しいです。
テンポが速すぎるし、ダウンした時は全員同じ直立姿勢だったり、ゲームそのものの部分でのキャラゲーとしての作り込みが薄いのはどうなのだろうとも思います。一応エンディングは全員あって（短いですが）それぞれにイラストがあるので、そういう、ゲームの外の部分は、ある程度充実しているのですが。
また、今作もですが、「相手を選んでCPUと自由に対戦」という機能が無い格ゲーが、なぜこんなに多いのかと思います。
